page.title: 15THE RAILWAY
page.content: The huge Basford Hall marshalling yard (22 miles of track) south of Crewe Station and the smaller sidings at Gresty Green were constantly busy 50 years ago splitting up and remaking freight trains. Many lines and men are now gone. In 1960 approx. 260 men worked at Basford Hall; today about 30. Freight liner traffic is important and Gresty Green where new rail track is amade up. The old goods shed is now a private warehouse. Crewe South engine shed and its turntable are now gone. The B.R. vehicle repair shop has been taken over by National Carriers. Only the carriage sheds are still used for their original purpose. Remains of World War 2 air-raid shelters can still be seen in th surrounding fields.
